measured_by: refusal or acceptance of 50-50 monetary gambles
justification: The text defines risk aversion as cases "where people refuse fair gambles (e.g., a 50% chance to win or lose $5)", indicating that willingness to accept such gambles is the behavioral measure of the construct.

measured_by: choice of prenatal tests with specified miscarriage risk vs detection benefit
justification: The article reports that participants "were shown to select riskier prenatal tests when using a foreign language," showing that decisions among prenatal test options served to quantify medical risk-taking.

measured_by: responses to moral dilemmas assessed with the CNI model
justification: It references "Foreign Language Effects on Moral Dilemma Judgments: An Analysis Using the CNI Model," implying that answers to moral dilemmas, analyzed via the CNI framework, operationalize moral judgment.

measured_by: truthfulness ratings of true and fake news headlines
justification: The passage notes that when "evaluating news, people using their foreign language are less likely to believe true news and slightly more willing to believe fake news," signifying that participants' truthfulness ratings of news items are the measurement of this construct.
